snippet: Early studies of prescription drug use by people buying health insurance through health exchanges suggest that they are often sicker than those insured by employers.
abstract: Two new studies of prescription drug use by people buying health insurance through health exchanges suggest that they are often sicker than those insured by employers; studies also find that insurers are not spending more on exchange enrollees for drug coverage, since patients are being asked to pay more out-of-pocket.
lead_paragraph: Early studies of prescription drug use by people buying health insurance through health exchanges suggest that they are often sicker than those insured by employers.

headline.main: Health Law Drug Plans Are Given a Check-Up
headline.print_headline: Health Law Drug Plans Are Given a Check-Up
